aiEstimation.title: Pro tips for best results

bullets.weights: Add weights or volumes for precision (e.g., "150 g chicken breast" vs. "chicken breast").
bullets.details: Mention cooking methods or standout ingredients (e.g., "grilled with olive oil").

bullets.frame: Keep every item fully in frame and uncovered.

bullets.tone: Speak naturallyâ€”as if you were typing.
bullets.details: Mention weights, ingredients, and cooking methods.

aiEstimation.footer: For the most accurate results, use measured amounts whenever you can.

primary.label: Calories & Protein
primary.title: Priority
primary.description: Hit these to stay on track with your goal and build muscle.

secondary.label: Fat
secondary.title: Baseline
secondary.description: This baseline supports hormones and nutrient absorption.

filler.label: Carbs
filler.title: Flexible
filler.description: Your workout fuel. Once calories, protein, and fat are set, carbs are flexible.

bullets.ring: The ring fills as you log meals.
bullets.close: Close the ring to stay within todayâ€™s budget.

bullets.weekly: Judge progress by your weekly average, not a single day.

bullets.ring: The ring fills as you log protein.
bullets.close: Close the ring to reach todayâ€™s minimum.

bullets.eachMeal: Include a protein source in every meal or snack.
bullets.spread: Spread intake throughout the day for better recovery.
bullets.over: A little over is okayâ€”aim to meet or gently exceed the target.

hitTarget.title: Hit your daily target
hitTarget.body: Keep a steady baseline each day so energy and meals stay satisfying. This value serves only as a baseline and may be exceeded at any time as long as total calories are maintained.

why.title: Why it matters
why.body: Dietary fat supports hormones, helps absorb vitamins, and keeps you full.

bullets.cook: Cook with olive or avocado oil; include nuts, seeds, whole eggs, and salmon.
bullets.balance: Saturated fat is fine in moderationâ€”balance it across the day.

total.title: A flexible total
total.body: No fixed targetâ€”carbs fill remaining calories after protein and fat. Expect dayâ€‘toâ€‘day changes.

bullets.adjust: Increase on hard training days; scale down on rest days.
bullets.timing: Choose mostly slowerâ€‘digesting carbs; use faster carbs around workouts.

bullets.whole: Rice, potatoes, oats, beans, fruit, wholeâ€‘grain breads or wraps.
bullets.limit: Limit sugary drinks and ultraâ€‘processed sweets.
